question.questionText: Paula wants to test a food to see if it contains acid and/or sugar. When Paula added water and yeast to a sample of the food and put the mixture in a warm water bath, the mixture began to fizz and bubble. Paula tested for the other substance. What would the test results tell her?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: If gas (carbon dioxide) is produced, the food contains acid. If no gas is produced, the food does not contain acid.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Not much sugar is in the thing she is testing.
The results tell her that acid is present.
If it has a lot of sugar a little bit of sugar or no sugar at all.
If the tube shoots up then the substance has acid in it.
The test results will tell her that the one with sugar has acid. Because it bubbles up.
That it either has sugar or it does not have sugar.
The test results tell her how much gas is in the food.
If the vinegar made the baking soda react it would shoot carbon dioxide into the pusher, then she needs to write down how many milliliters of carbon dioxide there is.
Her test results would tell her what had more sugar in it.
If the syringe went up at all, that means the food contains acid. We already know that the food contains sugar because it fizzed.
The more carbon dioxide the more carbon dioxide it has in it.
If it had acid and how much sugar.
Vitamin C or acid.
How much acid and or sugar there is.
If the syringe goes way up it has a lot of acid, if not has a little or none.
The results would tell her how much acid was in the substance.
It will tell her if there is a lot or not a lot of sugar in the food.
The amount of acid in the food.

Her results will tell her how much acid is in the juice. The more carbon dioxide or gas the more acid it has.
The syringe will go up and will tell you how many milliliters.
It would tell her that how much acid is in lemon, lime, or tangerine.
If the syringe goes up that means there is acid in the food.
The test results would tell her that the food substance that fizzed and bubbled the most has the most sugar.
It would tell her that the one which bubbled up most must have acid or sugar.
That is how much acid or sugar it has.
